sentences.sContent: She eventually fell into an uneasy sleep.
sentences.sCn: 她终于睡着了，但睡得并不踏实。

sentences.sContent: Ninety percent of those questioned felt uneasy about nuclear power.
sentences.sCn: 受访者中有90%的人对核能感到忧虑。

sentences.sContent: ...The colored people felt uneasy at the presence of the whites in their neighborhoods...
...are uneasy living in a thickening cloud of radio waves from mobile phone towers and the gadgets they communicate with...

synos.tran: 不舒服的；心神不安的；不稳定的

remMethod.val: un(不) ＋ easy(安心的) → 不安心的 → 心神不安的

words.tran: 不自在地；不稳定地；心神不安地

trans.tranOther: worried or slightly afraid because you think that something bad might happen
